alert.note: Alert for Limestone (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 3:55PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lauderdale and northwestern Limestone Counties through 415 PM CST... At 355 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lexington, or 21 miles northwest of Athens, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anderson, Lester and Good Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for north central and northwestern Alabama.
